intro: Homalanthus elegans, commonly known as the elegant spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
